VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Allow a Buyer to Access Account Information with Fewer Clicks

Provide quick access to the sections of the My Account page from anywhere on your Visualforce storefront or Experience Builder site. The B2B Commerce Header component in an Experience Builder site and the header component in a Visualforce storefront page now support a dropdown menu for the My Account link. Populate the dropdown menu with links to your supported My Account page sections, and save your buyers a few clicks during their storefront session.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the sections of the My Account page were accessible only by clicking the My Account link in the header on the Visualforce storefront. The B2B Commerce Header component for an Experience Builder site didn't show the My Account link at all. Accessing the individual sections of the My Account page required several clicks from anywhere on your storefront.

This enhancement helps buyers access the My Account page sections more efficiently, and allows you to easily reuse resources between your Visualforce storefront and Experience Builder site.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the CC Menu object includes a new field, Show in My Account Menu. When this field is enabled, the menu is used for the My Account link in the header. This field applies to the B2B Commerce Header component in an Experience Builder site and the standard header component in a Visualforce storefront page.

To begin using the My Account menu on your Visualforce storefront or Experience Builder site, complete the steps in https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.b2b_commerce_menu_my_account.htm to:

Update any clones of the default B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin permission set that you've created to add access to the Show in My Account Menu field.
Create the appropriate CC Menu and CC Menu Item records that correspond to the default sections of the My Account page.
Refresh the menu cache.

The My Account menu automatically becomes available in both of the following components:

The standard header component for a Visualforce storefront page.
The B2B Commerce Header component for an Experience Builder site.
NOTE
For new installations, the CC_Data_DefaultStore and CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min static resources already include the appropriate CC Menu and CC Menu Item records.
A storefront supports only one CC Menu record where Show in My Account Menu is enabled. When a storefront has more than one CC Menu record where this field is enabled, the record with the lowest Sequence value has priority.
You can still use this menu and its menu items in just the Visualforce header, even if your storefront doesn't use an Experience Builder site page.
